segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful compared to the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The path is neat, the bushes are trimmed, and everything seems calm.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s such a stark contrast to the kitchen, where everything is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sunlight coming through the window makes the water on the floor sparkle a little.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But it’s still a mess, and it’s only going to get worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman ever looks outside and wishes she could just escape.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids don’t even seem to notice the garden.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They’re too focused on their little cookie heist.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I bet they’d love to be out there playing instead of causing trouble in here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But for now, they’re stuck in this chaotic moment.
segments.speaker: PAR
